A box contains 2 white balls, 3 black balls and 4 red balls. In how many ways can 3 balls be drawn from the box, if at least one black ball is to be included in the draw?
answer:
We may have(1 black and 2 non-black) or (2 black and 1 non-black) or (3 black).

Required number of ways = (3C1 x 6C2) + (3C2 x 6C1) + 3C3
= (45 + 18 + 1)= (3 x <sup>6 x 5</sup>⁄<sub>2x 1</sub>) + (<sup>3 x 2</sup>⁄<sub>2x 1</sub>x6) + 1

= 64

question: 3     4    13    38    87    166    289
answer:
The given number series is based on the following pattern.

4 – 3 = 12

38 – 13 = 25 = 52

87 – 38 = 49 = 72

168 – 87 = 81 = 92

289 – 168 = 121 = 112

Obviously, 166 is the wrong number.

question: I. 9x2 – 18x + 5 = 0      II. 2y2 – 9y + 10 = 0
answer:
9x2 – 18x + 5 = 0 

9x2 – 3x - 15x + 5 = 0 

3x(3x-1)-5(3x-1)= 0

x = 5/3 ; 1/3

2y2 – 9y + 10 = 0

2y2 – 4y - 5y + 10 = 0

2y(y -2) -5(y - 2) = 0

y = 5/2; 2

question: In how many ways a committee, consisting of 5 men and 6 women can be formed from 8 men and 10 women?

                                      = (8C3 x 10C4)

                                      = (<sup>8 x 7 x 6</sup>⁄<sub>3 x 2x 1</sub> x (<sup>10 x 9 x 8 x 7</sup>⁄<sub>4 x 3 x 2x 1</sub>)

question: From a group of 7 men and 6 women, five persons are to be selected to form a committee so that at least 3 men are there on the committee. In how many ways can it be done?
answer:
We may have (3 men and 2 women) or (4 men and 1 woman) or (5 men only).

Required number of ways = (7C3 x 6C2) + (7C4 x 6C1) + 7C5

            = (<sup>7 x 6 x 5</sup>⁄<sub>3 x 2 x 1</sub> x <sup>6 x 5</sup>⁄<sub>2 x 1</sub>) + (7C3 x 6C1) + 7C2

              = 525 + (<sup>7 x 6 x 5</sup>⁄<sub>3 x 2 x 1</sub> x 6) + (<sup>7 x 6</sup>⁄<sub>2 x 1</sub>)

          = (525 + 210 + 21)

          = 756.

In a group of 6 boys and 4 girls, four children are to be selected. In how many different ways can they be selected such that at least one boy should be there?
answer:
Required number  of ways  = (6C1 x 4C3) + (6C2 x 4C2) + (6C3 x 4C1) + (6C4)

   = (6C1 x 4C1) + (6C2 x 4C2) + (6C3 x 4C1) + (6C2)

   = (6 x 4) +(<sup>6 x 5</sup>⁄<sub>2x 1</sub>x<sup>4 x 3</sup>⁄<sub>2x 1</sub>) +     = (<sup>6 x 5 x 4</sup>⁄<sub>3 x 2x 1</sub>x4) + (<sup>6 x 5</sup>⁄<sub>2x 1</sub>)     = (24 + 90 + 80 + 15)

                                            = 209.

question: How many students were there in the school during the year 1996?
answer:
Total no of students who joined still 1996

= 300+250+500+450=1500

Total no of students who left till 1996

= 250+350+400+300=1300

  Net increase in the strength of the school

= 1500-1300=200

Initial strength of the school in 1992 = 1500

So, strength of the school during 1996= 1500+200=1700
